resources.string: View Tutorial
What is SOLA Open Tenure ?

Open Tenure is an open source software app, developed by UN-FAO, for the in-the-field recording of property rights. 
 The boundaries of a land use can be mapped and property and land user details can be captured as well as images of 
 supporting documents and photos of the land use. 
 Open Tenure is used with a web based community server (such as SOLA Community Server) where existing land use details 
 and map imagery can be downloaded before field capture and new details can be uploaded after field capture.
Claim Details

The News Tab give you access to the FAO website 
 It also provides more details about 
 SOLA and Open Tenure open source software
\n \n The Community Map Tab gives you access to the Open Tenure map viewer

Shows the list of land users 
 
 Select one element of the list to edit details about the person 
 including name, date of birth, gender, ID details and photo 
 
 ....or....

The List of Recordings Tab displays a list of land use recordings that have been downloaded or recorded on your device along with their status 
 
 Status Types: 
 • L - Lodged 
 • U - Uploaded/Unvalidated 
 * C - Correction request 
 • M - Validated 
 • R - Rejected 
 • W - Withdrawn

Select a recording from the list to view or edit its details and map the land use 
 
 Use the blue Arrow Icon to upload a claim to the Community Server 
 
 Use the red X Icon to remove a claim from the list locally

Describe a land use recording by entering details through a series of tabs 
 The first 6 tabs are fixed format tabs for describing LADM/STDM characterics. 
 The last 2 tabs are dynamic and the contents of these tabs are defined using the SOLA Web Admin application. 
 
 The Recording Tab has these fields: 
* "Land name" being the name or identifier that the land use area is commonly known as 
* "Recording type" being the (LADM or SOLA extenstion) primary right for a property 
* "Land Use" being the (SOLA extension) current primary land use for the property 
* "Date recording applies from" being the date the began 
* "Notes" being any additional details considered appropriate by the Community Recorder 
 
 At the bottom of the form are two buttons: 
* "Add (or Modify) Land User" to record the land user(s) of this land 
* "Select Claim for Correction" in the case of a recording that needs correction and a request for correction has been recorded. This allows that correction request to be linked to a previous land use recording

Allows you to define the boundaries of the land user using the map imagery as the base map for a reference and, where necessary, the GPS position from the mobile device's built-in GPS. 
 
 Once all the boundaries have been defined, a map of the land use can be generated and added as a supporting document to the recording

A Long Press on the map creates a new boundary corner 
 
 A (light) Tap on a boundary corner puts that boundary corner in Edit Mode 
 Edit Mode operations are: 
* the white X icon deletes the selected boundary corner 
* the white Compass icon provides precise spatial editing.Arrows in each cardinal direction display. 
 Use these arrows for precise definition of boundary corners and then the white Dot icon when boundary corner is satisfactorily defined 
* the white Circle with a Diagonal icon exits Edit Mode 
 
 Long press on an existing marker to drag it around 
 
 Open Tenure can snap to existing boundary corners or onto existing boundary lines

Displays a list of documents attached to the land use recording 
 
 A document can be selected from the list to view its details 
 The red X icon deletes the document from the property claim

The Paperclip icon allows you to attach an existing file that has previously been stored on your device 
 
 The Camera icon activates the camera on your device so that you can take a photo and for that image /n to be attached to the property claim

Record the land user or land name of adjacent properties according to their location relative 
 to the recording being recorded (ie north, south, east and west) 
 
 Where there are adjacient recordings recorded by Open Tenure, these recordings will automatically be displayed as adjacent.

Displays a list of any change requests made for this land use recording 
 
 To look at the details of a correction request, note the name of an existing recording (or the land user) and search for it using one of those names in the List of Recordings tab

Lists the holdership shares recorded for the land use recording 
 (Open Tenure assumes a simple (100 percent) holdership in the name of the contact person and this is what will be initially seen in this list. This simple 100 percent share arrangement can be modified using the following mechanisms)

 A share can be selected from the list to look at the land user(s) associated with that share and to change the land user details or add further land users for the share

 The counter control allows the percentage associated with the share to be changed

 The red X icon allows a share to be deleted

 The green + icon allows you to add a new share to record a more complex ownership arrangement for the property claim

 Open Tenure will not allow you to record a holdership share arrangement that does not total 100 percent

The White Triangle enclosing an exclamation mark icon displays when Open Tenure is run for the first time. This function 
 must be used then to initialise Open Tenure for use with a particular Community Server 
 
 The Logon icon gives you access to the Community Server once you have entered your user name and password 
 (obtained by enrolling on the Community Server website) 
 
 The Lock icon encrypts the data captured using Open Tenure for when this data is submitted by email 
 
 The List icon gives access to: 
• "Settings" to define the url values and map layer for the Community Server, Geoserver (map imagery) and survey form 
• "View Tutorial" to re-visit this tutorial

Community Map Tab Icons: 
* the File Download icon only displays when you are zoomed in at near maximum scale and starts the download of map imagery tiles 
 from the Geoserver imagery for the area currently displayed in the Open Tenure map viewer 
* the Logon icon to display logon form (you must first enrol as a user on the Community Server) 
* the (folded) Map icon centres the Open Tenure map display on the community's defined area of interest 
* the Bulls-Eye target icon centres the Open Tenure map display on your current location 
* the cloud Download icon starts the download of land use recording details from the Community Server for the area currently 
 displayed in the Open Tenure map viewer 
* the List icon presents the Open Tenure base map layer options available for selection

Click on the + icon to add a new person or group and record the applicable details: 
 
 Person 
* "First name" (mandatory) - record first names 
* "Last name" (mandatory) - family name 
* "Date of birth" (mandatory) - use date control or enter manually in format YYYY-MM-DD 
* "Gender" (mandatory) 
* "ID Type " select value from list 
* "ID Number" record from ID document 
* "Postal Address" 
* "Email Address" - this email address is where automated messages concerning the property claim will be sent 
* "Mobile phone number" 
* "Contact phone number" 
 
 Group 
* "First name" (mandatory) - name of the group 
* "Date of Establishment" (mandatory) - use date control or enter manually in format YYYY-MM-DD 
* "ID Number" - may not exisit but for legally recognised entities, like companies, record their registration number 
* "Postal Address" 
* "Email Address" - this email address is where automated messages concerning the property claim will be sent 
* "Mobile phone number" 
* "Contact phone number"

The Flag Person icon to record a new property claim 
 
 The Logon icon to display the logon form that will then allow you to upload completed land user recordings 
 
 The List icon gives access to: 
• "Settings" to define the url values and map layer for the Community Server, Geoserver (map imagery) and survey form 
• "View Tutorial" to re-visit this tutorial 
• "Backup local data" to backup property claim data recorded on your device

The Save icon saves all data describing this claim 
 
 The Export icon creates a compressed zip file of the claim (for emailing to the community server) 
 once the land use recording has been completely recorded and saved 
 
 The Print icon creates a summary of the property claim details 
 once land recording has been mapped and land use recording has been saved. 
 
 The List icon contains a menu option of View Tutorial to re-visit this tutorial

The wrench icon allows you to switch between different map editing modes such as: adding markers to the main boundary, adding markers which are not part of the main boundary or measuring the distance between markers. 
 
 The green + icon creates a new boundary corner at the current position as determined by the device's built-in GPS. Because of the accuracy constraints of the built-in GPS, this boundary corner should be repositioned (use a Long Press action on the map display) relative to the map imagery if the boundary position is clear on the map imagery. In such situations, Open Tenure records both the GPS position and the map imagery position. 
 
 The white Rotate icon rotates the map and displays the device's compass. To stop the Rotate function, use the white Circle with a Diagonal icon. A two finger swirl motion will also rotate the map. Useful for in-the-field orientation 
 The Bullseye Target icon centres the map on your current position (as determined by built-in GPS) 
 
 The Device icon generates a map based on the current map display and automatically attaches this as a supporting document to the property claim. In the case of a previous map being stored as a supporting document it replaces the older map.
\n \n You must now initialize the application.

This icon initialises Open Tenure by configuring it for use with the test SOLA Community Server. 
 When you need to connect to the community server for your community you will need to clear any 
 Open Tenure data on your device, change the url settings for the community server and re-initialise. 
 
 These steps are: 
 1) Using Android Settings - Apps - Open Tenure. Click on the Clear data button 
 2) Change the url values in Settings menu option available from the List of Claims Tab on the initial main Open Tenure form 
 3) Use the Triangle icon to (re) Initialise Open Tenure (available from the News Tab on the initial main Open Tenure form)

..and now.. 
 
 Please try using Open Tenure. If you have any suggestions or you come across any issues 
 please contact us (neil.pullar@fao.org) 

 You can view this tutorial again at any time selecting "View Tutorial" from the List - View Tutorial menu option.
